mil3.1.4:1.1: Then, it occurred to King Milinda,
mil3.1.4:1.2: “This wise bhikkhu is very competent to converse with me. There will be many matters to be asked, but there will be so many unasked, and then the sun will set. Why don’t I converse with him in the inner palace tomorrow?”
mil3.1.4:2.1: Then the king said to Devamantiya,
mil3.1.4:2.2: “Well then, Devamantiya, announce this to the venerable one, ‘There will be conversation with the king in the inner palace tomorrow morning’.”
mil3.1.4:2.3: After he said this, King Milinda rose from his seat, having received permission from the elder Nāgasena, mounted his chariot, and left, repeating to himself, “Nāgasena, Nāgasena!”
mil3.1.4:3.1: Then Devamantiya said to venerable Nāgasena,
mil3.1.4:3.3: ‘There will be conversation with the king in the inner palace tomorrow morning’.”
mil3.1.4:3.4: The elder approved, saying “It is well.”
mil3.1.4:3.5: Then, in the early morning, Devamantiya, Anantakāya, Maṅkura, and Sabbadinna approached King Milinda, and said to him,
mil3.1.4:3.8: “With how many bhikkhus may he come?”
mil3.1.4:3.9: “He may come with as many bhikkhus as he likes.”
